intro: Ruellia porrigens, commonly known as the purple ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to blue. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are square in cross-section. Ruellia porrigens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes due to its attractive flowers and adaptability to various soil conditions.
